name: Molecular Biomedical Engineering
description: Introduces the fundamentals of molecular biology for biomedical engineers.Â Designed for junior or senior biomedical engineering students to learn the nomenclature and current state of knowledge of the eukaryotic cell and its related structures. Topics include protein structure and function, enzymes, the structure and nature of DNA and the cellular structure and function of various cellular organelles. Students will also learn about energy and the function of mitochondria and chloroplast, cellular communication and the function of the extracellular matrix.
